citation.article-title: Catellatospora koreensis sp. nov., a novel actinomycete isolated from a gold-mine cave.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Catellatospora koreensis sp. nov.
Catellatospora koreensis (ko.re.en'sis. M.L. adj. koreensis of Korea (pertaining to Korean soil from which the organism was isolated))
Forms a welL-developed, branched substrate mycelium.
An aerial mycelium is absent.
Short chains of spores are borne directly on substrate mycelium.
Spores are cylindrical and non-motile.
Spore surface is smooth.
The colour of substrate mycelium is cream to light yellow.
Globose bodies are formed.
A soluble pigment is not produced.
Good growth on oatmeal agar, inorganic salt}starch agar, glucose/asparagine agar, glucose}yeast extract agar, Hickey-Tresner agar and Bennett agar.
Poor to moderate growth on glycerol/asparagine agar, yeast extract agar, nutrient agar, tyrosine agar and tapwater agar.
Aerobic.
Gram-positive.
Catalase-positive.
Urease-negative.
Nitrate is reduced to nitrite.
H2S is not produced.
Grows at pH 6.0-9.0.
The temperature range for growth is between 20 and 37 °C.

Utilizes L-arabinose, D-cellobiose, D-fructose, D-galactose, D-glucose, D-lactose, maltose, D-mannose, D-raffinose, starch, sucrose and D-xylose as carbon sources.Noutilization of D-arabinose, dextran, gluconate, inulin, D-melezitose, melibiose, methyl α-dglucoside, L-rhamnose, D-ribose, salicin, L-sorbose, D-trehalose, adonitol, dulcitol, butanol, meso-erythritol, ethanol, glycerol, meso-inositol, 2-propanol, propanol, D-mannitol, D-sorbitol and D-xylitol.
Does not degrade adenine, hippurate, hypoxanthine, DL-tyrosine and xanthine.
Hydrolyses casein, gelatin and starch but not DNA.
Grows on 0.001% brilliant green and 0.0001% crystal violet.
No growth on 3% NaCl and 0.01% lysozyme.
Susceptible to 50 μg novobiocin ml-1, 20 μg vancomycin ml-1, 100 μg streptomycin ml-1, and 10 μg tetracycline ml-1, but resistant to 50 μg gentamicin ml-1and 5 μg neomycin ml-1.
Cell wall contains meso-diaminopimelic acid, rhamnose, ribose, xylose, mannose and glucose (a type II cell wall and a variant of sugar pattern D).
The acyl type of muramic acid is glycolyl.
The predominant menaquinone is MK-10(H4), with minor amounts of MK-9(H4) and MK-10(H6).
The diagnostic phospholipids contain phosphatidylethanolamine, diphosphatidylglycerol and phosphatidylinositol.
Glucosamine-containing phospholipid and phosphatidylcholine are absent.
Mycolic acids are absent.
The predominant fatty acids (>15±0% of total) are iso-C16:0, iso-C15:0 and C17:1 acids.
A signi®cant amount of saturated, unsaturated and anteiso-branched fatty acids are also present.
The G­+C content of the DNA is 70.4 mol% (determined by HPLC).
Isolated from a gold-mine cave.
The type strain is LM 042T (=IMSNU 50729T).
